newsitem.title: USA: Cincinnati Purchasing Managers say April growth up.
newsitem.headline: Cincinnati Purchasing Managers say April growth up.

text.p: The Cincinnati chapter of the National Association of Purchasing Management said on Wednesday its April report showed business activity in the area was slightly stronger from March.
The group said growth was reflected in the report's new orders, backlog of orders and dollars spent by purchasing components.

New orders rose to 27 in April, from 18 in March, but was below the three-month average. However, new orders, as well as the production and employment components, remain higher than the three-year average.
Employment rose to 20, from March's 12, but the group said employment in the area "does not seem to be adding significant pressure on service prices."
Commodity prices fell to 16 in April, from 18 in March.

"This index continues to show stability with a low rate of increase for a six-month period, indicating at this point the strength in the economy is not resulting in alarming levels of higher prices," the group said. ((Derivatives desk 312-408-8750))
